intro: Statice gracilis, commonly known as slender sea lavender, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of the Mediterranean and the eastern Mediterranean. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family, which includes other salt-tolerant plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and spikes of small, pink or purple flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dunes and salt marshes. Statice gracilis is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and its ability to withstand saline conditions.
